ru.noties.requirements

Class EventDispatcher<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.noties.requirements.EventDispatcher<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventDispatcherActivity, EventDispatcherFragment

    public abstract class EventDispatcher<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstraction to allow resolving requirements from any context (not from android.content.Context). Provides 2 factory methods to work with Activity and Fragment.
    Since:
    1.1.0
    See Also:
    create(Activity), create(Fragment)

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static <A extends android.app.Activity> EventDispatcher<A> create(A activity)
        Factory method to obtain an instance of EventDispatcher that dispatches events through android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        activity - from which to dispatch events
        Returns:
        an instance of EventDispatcher
        See Also:
        EventDispatcherActivity

      • create

        public static <F extends android.app.Fragment> EventDispatcher<F> create(F fragment)
        Factory method to obtain an instance of EventDispatcher that dispatches events through android.app.Fragment.

        Please note that if you use this dispatcher or create your own, EventSource should consume events from a Fragment (and not from Activity)

        Parameters:
        fragment - from which to dispatch events
        Returns:
        an instance of EventDispatcher

        public abstract android.app.Activity activity()
        Returns:
